It's for sure more easy to identify that a system/website *is not* rest=
full than identify it *is* restfull......<br /><br />On Apr 29, 2009 9:11am=
, Stefan Tilkov <stefan.tilkov@...> wrote:<br />> Interestin=
g question. Here are some thoughts, definitely incomplete,<br />> <br />=
> for checking whether something uses HTTP and other Web standards<br />=
> <br />> RESTfully:<br />> <br />> <br />> <br />> - Do =
URIs identify things (resources)? Never mind the characters<br />> <br /=
>> they're made of, but check whether they identify e.g. a customer,=
 an<br />> <br />> email, an account, a step in a process, a shopping=
 cart =85 or is there<br />> <br />> just one URIs (or a small number=
 of URIs) and the identification<br />> <br />> contained in the mess=
age?<br />> <br />> - Can one apply more than one method to these res=
ources? There might<br />> <br />> be a few you can only GET, but pro=
bably most of those supporting POST,<br />> <br />> PUT or DELETE sho=
uld also support GET<br />> <br />> - Is a GET used in an "unsaf=
e" way, i.e. can a client follow links via<br />> <br />> GET wi=
thout fear of regret?<br />> <br />> - Do I need a description of the=
 URI structure, or can I navigate from<br />> <br />> resource to res=
ource via hyperlinks contained in resource<br />> <br />> representat=
ions?<br />> <br />> - Is what I can do to a resource at any particul=
ar point in time<br />> <br />> determined by what links are availabl=
e in the representation?<br />> <br />> - Are at least some resources=
 cacheable and provide appropriate Cache-<br />> <br />> control, Exp=
ires and/or ETag headers?<br />> <br />> - Is a conditional GET suppo=
rted, based on ETags or last modification<br />> <br />> date?<br />&=
gt; <br />> - Similarly, are conditional PUT or DELETE requests supporte=
d?<br />> <br />> - Are the different HTTP response codes used in lin=
e with their<br />> <br />> meaning in the spec? Or is everything &qu=
ot;tunneled" though 200 and 500?<br />> <br />> <br />> <br /=
>> <br />> <br />> Stefan<br />> <br />> --<br />> <br />=
> Stefan Tilkov, http://www.innoq.com/blog/st/<br />> <br />> <br =
/>> <br />> On 29.04.2009, at 04:57, cule_barca wrote:<br />> <br =
/>> <br />> <br />> ><br />> <br />> ><br />> <br /=
>> > I've just started with REST. So there are some difficuties f=
or me to<br />> <br />> > identify if a system/website is restul o=
r not?<br />> <br />> > Are there any methods(the way) to do it cl=
early/basicly ?<br />> <br />> > Example: is gmail restful system?=
 How to know it?<br />> <br />> ><br />> <br />> > Please=
 help me !<br />> <br />> ><br />> <br />> ><br />> <b=
